12$Condition: Panic Disorder$3/24/2019 12:35:51 AM$Reviewer: kaybee, 19-24 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$My first time on Effexor three years ago, I quit it cold turkey due to side effects. DO. NOT. DO. THIS. I threw up for a week, had cold chills, and couldn't leave my bed. It was full blown withdrawal. I recently had an uptick in my panic disorder and depression, compounded by PTSD. Because Effexor had worked to manage my day-to-day symptoms before, I was placed back on it. There are definitely side effects if I miss a dose, such as vomiting and dizziness. I've also noticed that even taking it regularly, I've developed an aversion to solid foods. It may be from the vomiting when I was changing doses, but it's pretty bothersome living off of yogurt and protein shakes until the drug starts wearing off at night. My panic disorders have become few and far between, and to me, that is worth the annoying side effects and dependence.

17$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$3/3/2019 11:37:06 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$1$4$DO NOT TAKE THIS POISON UNLESS YOU ARE OK WITH THE WITHDRAWAL SYMPTOMS. Yes it works for depression and anxiety but if you ever want to quit taking it you will go through hell. I was taking Zoloft and it quit working. Dr suggested effexor XR. It was like a miracle. I could enjoy life again. I woke up with a sense of possibility. Worked great for about 5 years then it seemed to quit working as well. So I upped my dose. Even then the results weren't the same as they had been. Finally after 10 years at the age of 28 I decided to work with my Dr and go on Prozac. I slowly decreased from 150 mg effexor down to 37.5 and was even to the point where I had samples of 37.5 I would open and dump out half. It didn't matter. Side effects we're HORRIBLE. I couldn't think. I would find myself just standing staring off into space not sure what I had been doing. Weird swooshing noises in my head. Took me a half hour one day just to get dressed because I couldn't focus. It was the worst experience of my life. It was impossible to work or drive or do anything normal. This medicine should be used only as a last resort.

column1: 35$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$4/3/2018 4:50:19 AM$Reviewer: Josh
column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm 38 male. Been taking Ativan daily for over 10 years to treat panic attacks and anxiety. All of sudden one day started having extreme disturbing thoughts and the Ativan was barely helping anymore. Miserable for about 6 months with this new strange anxiety/panic with crazy horrible thoughts was really creating a lot of despair in my life. Luckily and by the grace of God I found a deacon of my church that steered me to a really good psychiatrist. He prescribed me effexor xr 37.5 mg 2x a day. Initially no relief but after about 2 weeks slowly but surely I began to feel normal and not having any disturbing thoughts. What a blessing to feel at peace again. Wasn't even feeling much need for the Ativan anymore. Before the new anxiety/crazy thoughts started i was averaging .5 of Ativan a day and feeling fine for the most part. Then after I started having disturbing thoughts all of sudden and out of the blue (was on a trip driving out of town when it began). Anyways
column3: it was disturbing me so much that I was taking anywhere from 2mg to 3mg of Ativan a day just to get by and was still feeling miserable and feeling I was at my breaking point almost entirely from morning til night. And now for over a month i felt normal almost 100 percent of the time. Reduced my Ativan down to 1mg a day and sometimes don't even feel the need for it. I take 37.5 mg in the morning and at night and my goal is to get off the Ativan all together and only being on the effexor. Thank God it helped me tremendously and I hope anyone that suffers from what I did can get the help and peace that I did! God bless and heal all who suffer with all mental illness!!

78$Condition: Anxiousness associated with Depression$7/24/2016 3:33:40 PM$Reviewer: Joe Mama, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$5$This drug worked great.  I started on 75mg and stepped up to 150mg. After a few months doctor increased dosage to 225mg because worrying and paranoia were returning.  225mg worked awesome on my symptoms. It was so good not laying awake in bed, worrying about everything, thinking every whisper I heard at work was about me and feeling my blood pressure and heart rate rise, from the constant state of heightened alert required from my job.(Jailer) I stayed on this dosage for about a year and finally realized the side effects were not decreasing. The inability to orgasm, unbelievably excessive sweating (I had to change t shirts 6 hours into my shift at work) And the dreams! They seemed to last all night long and were so detailed and vivid and they seemed to continue from one night to the next!  It was almost like living another life while I slept. It became intolerable once these dreams started morphing into nightmares in which i would talk, cry and scream in my sleep (so says my wife, but I don't believe the crying part) and wake up sweating. I started taking a small dosage of welbutrin for my inability to orgasm (which I had no problem with, but my wife did). It didn't work.  Anyway, I had to quit because of the side effects, but the results for the intended purpose were incredible.  I am currently weaning off effexor and trying something else. Oh yeah!  I almost forgot the 3 to 4 days between bowel movements which culminated into an incredibly painful,humongous stool, when I finally was able to defecate! I mean really, really painful, to the point you doubt it would come out!  Another little bonus from this drug. But,hey, it worked so well, I will return to it if I can't find something better. Good luck!

column1: Patients should never wean themselves off their meds. You ARE NOT a doctor. Talk to your doctor or their nurse first and let them help you.

Therefore they are going to affect me different than they will affect you. There are so many meds in our world these days that cause some serious side affects and some are worse than others. column4: would have a seizure
column5: etc. Along with all of these issues I would get heart palpitations which I had never gotten before. I have no other health problems besides hypothyroidism which is treated. I literally had no idea what was wrong with me and I always thought it HAD to be something besides anxiety because I have always had anxiety and when this started & continued to happen I was under less stress than ever. column8: and everything else if basically perfect. I am a 22 year old female of average weight & height and have been on the generic of Effexor successfully for about 5 months now. 203$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$4/15/2014 10:14:13 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$1$4$As far as working to treat my anxiety--I have to say it worked fine~~although it started to raise my blood pressure.  I first started on 75 mg time released capsule and then to 150. Due to my increase in blood pressure, I needed to be taken off effexor.  We tapered it down...but I never, never, never felt this horrible!  I went off this medicine with my doctors help....but I can't believe the withdrawal symptoms.  Had I known the withdrawal was like this, I would have never started effexor in the first place--yes, it helped, but NOTHING is worth feeling like this.  From now on, I will check if there are any withdrawal symptoms on ANY medicine I may be prescribed---still can't believe how bad the withdrawal is---and to think some people just go off this stuff???  Don't know how they do/did it!  If someone came to me today and said they were being prescribed Effexor~~I would honestly tell them to NOT start it---the side effects are not worth it, at least not in my opinion!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$2$4$"I have general anxiety disorder and minor depression. Effexor has done wonders for me in both of these areas.  However
column3: this drug is a wicked Catch-22 because it is nearly impossible to go off it. Don't let any doctors fool you into believing you might experience ""minor withdrawal symptoms"".  This drug is evil when it comes to trying to get off the medication.  It is almost a guarantee that you will experience major nausea and flu-like symptoms
column4: dizziness
column5: ""brain zaps"" or what feel like jolts of electricity shooting through your head
column6: and major disorientation.  I have been trying to get off of this medication for over a year with no success.  My doctor tried to taper me off by substituting Prozac every other day
column7: but that does not work at all.  I'm still on 37.5mg and cannot figure out what to do.  All the while
column8: these doctors act like it's no big deal to go off this drug.  They have no idea what they're talking about unless they have experienced it themselves.  If you Google ""Effexor Withdrawal"" you will find hundreds of message boards with people complaining that they can't get off this medication.  If you take it
column9: plan to be on it the rest of your life.  Oh
column10: and it made me gain 20 pounds even though I work out 5 days a week.  "

I was always so tired so I took it at night but that didn't help. I am sensitive to medications and the withdrawls for Effexor were HORRIBLE. I didn't just stop either. I took a lower dose for a week then another lower dose for a week then half a dose for a week and so on. I was so sick. I was throwing up for 2 weeks and so sick for a month. I could hardly get out. I felt like little electrical shocks would zap my head. It's so hard to explain but I thought maybe I was wrong. I started reading other peoples experiences too and they were the same. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$5$"I wanted to share my experience on Effexor XR. I was put on this medication for social anxiety disorder about ten months ago. Initially when I first started taking the medication I only had one side effect of dry mouth which subsided after about three days. It took about two weeks before the medication started to show affect. Prior to taking Effexor XR I had extremely poor concentration at work
column3: mixed emotions and issues with social anxiety. Effexor XR did help my concentration a lot. It helped settle my emotions and I began to not care too much about things (in a good way). It didn't really help with social anxiety and I didn't expect it too either. About two months ago I decided I wanted to stop the medication because my fiance and I are would like to start a family within the year. Basically I just wanted to medication free. At first I just went cold turkey and that is a very BAD IDEA. I was nauseous
column4: tired and I had very severe brain zaps. To wean myself off the medication the second time
column5: I tried something different
column6: after reading a few others recommendations. I opened the capsule and took out 5 ""balls"" for the first day
column7: 10 the next and so on until there was only 5 left. This took a few weeks and I had no withdrawal symptoms apart from very minor ""brain zaps"". It has now been four days since my last capsule and I feel great I am so happy to be off this medication and If I had known now what I know I would never have started taking it in the first place.  (I also gained 10kg on this medication too). I know everyone is different but I just wanted to share my experience. "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$3$"I was on Effexor for about two years. towards the end
column3: I started having bad reactions and side effects. If I took the drug even five minutes later than normal
column4: I would vomit. If I took the drug without enough to eat
column5: I would vomit. The sickness was accompanied by sweating
column6: shivering
column7: and weakness.

column1: Going off the drug was akin to a heroin addiction. Visual hallucinations. Lucid dreams. Lucid nightmares. Stomach pains so bad that I blacked out. Sweating. Nausea. Dizziness. Extreme weakness. Panic attacks. Off the chart anxiety.

column2: I would like to point out that this was after a few years of taking the drug. It did work for a time and I remember thinking that I felt better (this was paired with therapy sessions).

column1: I also did not wean myself off of the drug. Once side effects started I stopped taking it. This was a mistake. My symptoms may have been greatly reduced if I had weaned off of this instead of going cold turkey.
I have had friends that have had similar experiences with this medication. I have also had friends that have had great experiences with this medication.
It is all a matter of your body and your reaction to medications. Sometimes you have to try a few before finding the one that is right for you. It is a journey. Good Luck."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$2$I went on this medication after being diagnosed with post partum anxiety. It pretty much made me lifeless...no emotions
column3: no feelings
column4: just there. Not even a year past when I learned ways to cope with the anxiety attacks
column5: tried to ween off this medication and ended up freaking out because I could not stand how sick I became. I had brain 'zaps' that would not subside and felt like a basket case. I immediately took a pill and felt great after 2 hours. Talked with my dr about trying it again and he suggested dropping the dose this time and for a few days I felt horrible with the brain 'zaps' and just generally miserable. This time though it subsided so I tried the next step which again made life impossible to live. I was in bed for a few days before I starting taking taking the normal does again. Finally after 2 years and a dr who I felt would not help me get off this medication I was able to quit cold turkey from the lowest does. It was awful. I was sick for a week straight before I learned that benadryl relaxed everything so the brain 'zaps' would disappear as long as I took it. I have never felt better and really wish I had looked up the withdrawal side effects for this drug. Some people get it worse than others and it can last up to weeks. It took 5 weeks before I was able to stop taking the benadryl. If you are taking this for a short-term please reconsider it took 2 years for what should have been only a few months.

45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$1$4$"I was diagnosed with Syncope.  I do not know why the doctor prescribed Effexor to help with my fainting spells but Effexor seemed to help.  My problem was not while I was taking Effexor because I had no problems while I was taking Effexor.  I was up to 225mg per day.  I had been taking Effexor for six years - then I decided it was time to wean myself off of Effexor.  This is when the problems started.  If you are trying to wean yourself off of Effexor - PLEASE BE CAREFUL!!!  I initially set a goal of one year to stop taking Effexor.  I was able to wean myself off in six months.  I think six months was too fast!  The withdrawl symptoms associated with Effexor are/were very serious for me.  I experienced severe ""brain shivers"" or ""brain zaps"" as some people call them.  It felt like my brain was being ""zapped"" by a nine volt battery every few minutes or hours.  I also experienced very severe depression.  I had never been diagnosed with depression before but I could tell what it was when I was trying to get off of Effexor.  I could not just stop taking one of the 35mg pills and then cut back on another 35mg pill.  My body and mind could not take the shock.  The capsules have  about 80 to 90 little micro-pills in them (I don't know what else to call them).  I had to open my capsule every day and take out one micro-pill from the capsule each day.  I did this for many months.  Sometimes I had to stop lowering my dose and ""level off"" for a week or two until my body got used to the lower dose.  Then I began lowering the dosage one micro-pill at a time until I had to level off again.  Every day it felt like a psychological torture.  It was horrible.  I felt like committing suicide many times.  My ""brain zaps"" were unbearable.  I did take cannibis I was able to get from a friend and that helped my symptoms a little bit.  If you are on Effexor - everything is good.  When you try to get off of Effexor - please BE CAREFUL. [email protected]  take your time - do not give up hope."

I think this is a dangerous drug and should not be taken without full knowledge of the side effects
column8: particularly when decreasing the dose.  I have been telling everyone I know to stay away from this medication.  I now understand why people can become suicidal from antidepressants.

407$Condition: Depression$12/19/2012 7:12:24 PM$Reviewer: davehill1967, 35-44 Male  (Patient) $2$1$1$I have put on 40 pounds, lost sex drive and experienced ED. The Effexor has really done a number on me. I feel more depressed because I have to take it than I do about my crazy life circumstances. I have had suicidal thoughts regularly while on the full dosage. I decided about 2 months ago to taper off my dosage starting with a 10mg reduction each day (opening the capsule and removing the granules which when counted are right at 150 total). By the 5th day, or 120mg I was a basket case. I decided to Try a different approach. I would remove 5mg making my 7 day intake 145mg. I would then do another week at 140mg, then the next week at 135mg and so on. This has worked. UNTIL last night. I had the single most Terrifying night in my almost 45 years of living. For starters, I take Ambien because I can’t sleep. It didn’t help at all last night. I landed in some weird state of mental being about an hour after laying down. I could not move. My eyes were closed and It took all I could do to open one eye, my right one. I was super-hyper aware of everything surrounding me, My 8yr old on one side, my wife on the other, their breathing, my heartbeat, the dripping faucet, the sleepless stepchild in the other room. It was as if I could hear the air move. I found myself plunged into sheer terror. It was as if everything I have ever read was presenting itself all at once in a barrage of information overload with letter and numbers mixed in no intelligible arrangement. I felt as though I was being immersed in this swirling craziness as if attached to a slingshot being thrust into the mayhem and jerked back out again. I was awake but had no control of anything, my thoughts or body. I could not form words to speak. I could see through my closed eyelids as though I had night-vision goggles on. A heaviness beyond description had settled on me. It passed around 3am. I was looking at the ceiling until 5:30. . I am struggling with the thoughts of this medicine and its death grip on me.

534$Condition: Depression$3/4/2012 10:59:30 AM$Reviewer: JJPet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$This was the 5th drug I have tried in the SSRI/SNRI class. When I tried Effexor, I had finally decided to consult with a psych. I had a similar reaction to all of these drugs, but my one time 18 mg. dose of Effexor was the worst; my body got the warm, tingly sensation, loss of coordination, hard to concentrate, hard to swallow, extreme head ache, body shakes, vomiting, no sleep for 2 days. I only took it one day, and three days later, my head is still pounding. Where as my internist had suggested that I stick with these symptoms for a week in hope they would get better, my psych wanted me to stop and head to the ER right away. Come to find out, not all people can matabolise the SSRI/SNRI drugs. I suggest listen to your body, and if the side effects do not feel right, please consult with psych before continuing to experiment with these drugs.

641$Condition: Bipolar Depression$8/17/2011 6:30:21 PM$Reviewer: kiaweron, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$3$I have been taking Effexor for 7 years.  It helped with my depression for several years, but being on this drug long term caused a multitude of physical problems. In addition to confusion, sexual dysfunction, constipation, constant gas, ringing in my ears, and memory problems, in the last year I have developed severe stomach problems, weird and frightening dreams, twitching of my legs, arms and hands. I weaned myself off this drug for 2 weeks, then went cold turkey 3 weeks ago when I realized my stomach problems were improving since I stopped taking Effexor.  Right now I fight unexpected feelings of irritablility on and off all day, sadness, and frustration, but I can eat anything I want, no more heartburn or indigestion.  My sex life is back, and I have more energy. I am trying to be aware of my moods and if I feel that I need medication again, it will not be Effexor.

column1: 658$Condition: Depression$7/24/2011 10:09:18 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I know that a lot of people say they have had problems coming off this medication but that is not always the case.  If you carefully follow your doctor's instructions there are a number of things you can do to make the transition quite manageable (including decreasing the dose very slowly and adding a drug like Prozac).  Never stop taking Effexor without your doctor's instructions but don't be frightened away from a medication that may help your life feel worth living again.  I have been taking 300mg/day Effexor for over a year now and it is the very best thing that has helped me manage my depression.  I have always followed my Doctor's instructions and have not had any problems with the medication.  I do have to be very careful not to miss a dose though or I experience a lot of dizziness and anxiety.  I have been treated for severe depressive disorder for about 6 years and have taken a number of different different medications as part of my treatment (including Prozac
column2: Wellbutrin
column3: and Lamictal).  I was only getting minimal benefit from depression medications when my PCP was prescribing them but since I started seeing a psychiatrist and she put me on Effexor I have been managing so so so much better (even when my Mom died of cancer last year).  I highly recommend getting a psychiatrist and talking with them about all the pros and cons if you are considering taking Effexor.

672$Condition: Neuropathic Pain$7/8/2011 9:05:06 PM$Reviewer: Bailey, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have had severe Fibromyalgia for about 15 years but not diagnosed until 6 years ago.  Since then I have been taking Gabapentin 600mg 3 x a day
column2: Skelaxin 800mg 3 x a day as well as Dermerol 50mg at least 3 x a day
column3: but usually 5 to 6 times a day  There was some relief but not much and was unable to sleep on my left side at all due to the severe pain in my hip and leg.  Added Elavil 75mg to help with sleeping which did help however the side effect of an increased desire for sweets eventually became too much to deal with.  As I was eating one thing
column4: I was thinking about what to have next.  With my height at 4' 10'' my weight ballooned up to 140 lbs I was very uncomfortable
column5: so I stopped taking it.  My pain was to the point I could barely function and I became severely depressed
column6: fatigued and my pain was off the charts
column7: at least as far as I was concerned.  After researching Cymbalta and Effexor I talked with my doctor and decided to give the Effexor xr 75mg a try.  I have been on it for 3 months now and I am very pleased with the results.  My depression has all but abated
column8: I have my ""bad"" days one or two days a week mainly fatigue but not as bad as it was.  But more importantly is my PAIN IS SO MUCH BETTER!  I am hoping to get off of the Gabapentin and Skelaxin as well as weaning off of the Demerol.  I'm finding that I don't need it as much as before.  As long as it continues to work for me I have no issue with staying on it.  I do have some side effects
column9: I always have a slight headache but I can deal with it
column10: if it gets too bad then I take some Ibuprofen.  The most annoying side effect is the sweating
column11: I live in the Desert Southwest where the temps often run 110 degrees in the summer months.  I'd rather sweat than be in pain.  The insomnia was the worst
column12: however I've found that if I take in the morning that seems to work for me. "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I was diagnosed with an anxiety disorder. And they gave me this drug to help.  It was hard for me to come to terms with taking medication
column3: just to get through the day.  I have been on it for 2 years now and have come to a place in my life where I've decided enough is enough.  I have more good days than bad and want to get off them.  I was only taking 75mg and the doctor said to take 37.5mg.  I didn't notice any side effects or difference in my moods.  Then I decided to take it one day and not the next.  I feel light headed and dizzy and nauseated.  YUK!!!  How do you get off these things?  I don't know if I can put up with the effects. Does anyone get off these things?  How long do the effects last?  Am I destined to stay on this drug for the rest of my life?

column1: I was told by a friend of mine (on the same drug) to divide the 37.5mg into half again.  I'm going to give this a try! Wish me luck
column2: after reading the other reviews
column3: I think I'm going to need it."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I was prescribed this med for menopausaul symptoms. Let me begin by saying that I am not a typical case. Six years ago at the young age of 28
column3: I become post-menopausal do to surgically removing ovarian tumors. Because of this
column4: I do not have hot flashes. My symptoms are extremely slow metabalism and low libido. So my doctor gave me Effexor in the smallest dose to hopefully combat these symptoms. Although I read all of the reviews here before taking it
column5: everyone reacts differently so I decided to try it. I took 1 pill Sunday night. Within an hour my heart began to race. I did not sleep all night
column6: and went to work the next day. My eyes were bugged out and I was wired
column7: I could have ran a marathon! By 2:00pm I started to come down
column8: my heart stopped racing but I was still wired. I did not take another dose Mon. evening
column9: and I slept well. However
column10: I woke up Tues. with a horrible headache. Within 15 minutes the diarehea started and then immediately the vomitting. I couldn't even keep down water. After vomitting 15 times
column11: I had to call off work and was able to go back to sleep. I slept over 14 hours that day and finally kept down soup at 4:00pm. Another full night of sleep
column12: Wed. I was a little groggy and Thurs. I felt like myself. All of this was only with ONE DOSE and the minimum dosage at that! Although everyone reacts differently
column13: please research this well and have someone available who can monitor you and help you if you need it. This is very potent stuff. Good Luck.

column1: 754$Condition: Panic Disorder$3/16/2011 1:42:41 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$5$"My husband lost his job and we Couldn't afford $150.00 a month so I went to the dr and was put on a cheaper but just as effective medicine. I was not told about all the wicked withdrawal side effects. I took effexor 150mg for 1 year and came off of it cold turkey to start my new med. Never again will I do this. I actually thought I was having a nervous breakdown! The constant crying I could handle but when the dizziness and the brain zaps started it really scared me. I went to a doctor who told me that I should have been weaned off of that one and it will take 2 to 3 weeks for the withdrawal symptoms to ease. Now I have to take Klonopine for a few weeks to help with the symptoms but I will have to be weaned off of that also!!! People needs to be aware of what they are taking including the withdrawal symptoms and some physicians fail to explain things to them like they should!!!! "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"Started taking this med about 6 years ago now for depression and anxiety after celexa went generic and was no longer effective for me. I take 150mg/day. Is pretty effective although some days I feel like a need a larger dose. I don't really notice any side effects when I take it correctly but like other writers have mentioned DO NOT miss a dose or withdrawl kicks in immediately. I ran out once and missed 2 days and thought I had the flu or mono for a week. I can always tell immediatly if I've forgotten to take my medicine within a about 4 hours.

column1: Remember not every medication works for every person. Also when 37.5mg may be effective for one person another may need 150mg to be effective. Do not just assume because the doctor started you out on one dose that this will work for you. Keep in close contact with your doctor so that adjustments can be made if one dose isn't working for you. I do agree though that family doctors and internists should not be allowed to prescribe psychiatric medications without scheduling psychiatrist followup with their patients first. I know my doctor wrote me the rx when I asked and then just keeps renewing it. Not a good idea. "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$2$5$"I wanted to tell other people that I think there is a way to get off this drug. I'll tell you what I am doing that seems to lessen the withdrawal effect. First get a notepad because you are going to want to write everything down because you will be decreasing your dosages. Your effexor XR capsule will have little white beads inside of it. Depending on your dosage
column3: that is how many beads are in it. My dose is 75 mg
column4: so I have 75 little white beads in it. Step 2 is to get a small dark colored bowl and a pencil. Next wiggle ""cap"" off the capsule. This is the shorter end of the capsule. Once you have it off then set it to the side. Now you will see that there are the tiny little white beads inside. Do not dump the entire content of beads into the dark colored bowl! (I use the dark colored bowl since it's easier to spot and count the beads). Now while holding the capsule
column5: tip it slightly to loosen the beads up and grab your pencil. With the pencil tip
column6: easily scrape the beads out one at a time if you can. Always check your bowl and COUNT the white beads because you need to be exact. EVERY DAY YOU WILL REDUCE YOUR DOSAGE BY 5 WHITE BEADS! DON'T REDUCE BY ANYMORE THAN THAT OR YOU WILL DEFINITELY EXPERIENCE WITHDRAWAL SYMPTOMS! Once you remove 5 beads from the capsule
column7: screw the top ""cap"" on snug. You will have to wiggle it back on. Discard the beads preferably in an old medicine bottle with a child-proof cap. Take the capsule with at least a bottle of water to wash down and WITH food. Do not take with juice because I heard it can increase the effects of medications. So far I have reduced by Effexor dosage from 75 mg to 40mg with no side effects. I am really starting to feel like I am getting my personality back! Plus I have dropped a few pounds since my body is feeling alive again. I recommend this method to anyone wanting to get off this Effexor nightmare. Do not stop cold turkey or you'll be like a person experiencing a heroin withdrawal and that's not a pretty sight!"

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I experienced HORRIBLE anxiety after my first child was born

column6: and they put me on Effexor XR.  It started working within a few days and significantly increased the quality of my life.  I could take care of my baby again and began sleeping better and enjoying life again.  The only side effect I noticed was strange dreams

25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I started taking Effexor XR about a year and a half ago to deal with a divorce.  It worked very very well.  I did experience some weight gain (about 10 lbs) and loss of interest in sex.  However
column3: I still feel that if you need it you have to take it.  There's no point in suffering when there is something that can immediately help. After reading countless ""caveats"" about coming off it
column4: I weaned myself off very slowly and with direction from my Dr. I reduced my dosage by 37.5mg 1 month at a time.  IT WORKED VERY VERY WELL.  I experienced little to no withdrawel symptoms.  I've been off the med for about 10 weeks.  Sadly I'm beginning to have more episodes of feeling depressed; not being able to get out of bed
column5: having little-to-no energy
column6: and am probably going to go back on it.  I really wanted to be ""free and clear"" of the med and I'm not sure that it's possible. Some people have a chemical imbalance and it's beyond their control.  Sadly I'm feeling that I'm one of those people..."

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have been taking effexor xr for five years now and i am at 225mg in the winter then decrease to 150mg for the summer months. i dont have any side effects with it unless i forget to take the medication in the morning and by bedtime i start to feel the withdraw symptoms which can get very severe.

35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$I Suffered from severe anxiety for years before I was prescribed Effexor XR-75mg once daily. It has changed my life and has worked wonders for me. I hardly ever have any episodes of anxiety or anxiety attacks like I did before and they were severe! Been on it for 10 years. The downside is definitely missing even 1 dose or trying wean off. It is horrible. Missing 1 dose makes me feel like I have the flu times a thousand. I wish I knew when I was prescribed this
column3: just how terrible the withdrawals can be. As wonderful as it has been for me
column4: it is scary to think what would happen if I got stuck somewhere w/o my Effexor!! Don't EVER try to stop taking this drug w/o consulting your doctor! I tried one time and made it for almost 4 agonizing days w/o my daily dose before I thought I was going to die.

column1: 1084$Condition: Depression$3/25/2010 3:31:56 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $1$1$1$This medication gave me bad side after 8 months of trearment. I started having feelings of being on edge

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$3$4$I was on Effexor XR 75 mg for about 5 years.  I suddenly began having a dizziness that was unexplained.  Emotionally
column3: I felt good though
column4: and thought maybe it was time to get off the drug.  I reduced my dosage down to 37.5 for two weeks
column5: then cut the few remaining pills in half for about 10 days.  What ensued from there has been a nightmare.  I was having severe brain shivers most of the day every day for over two weeks.  Brain shivers are like an electrical stimulus to your brain.  My emotions and sensitivity to light and sound were severe.  My doctor was totally unavailable to me during this process.  It has now been over a month and all of these symptoms are still happening
column6: although to a lesser degree.  However
column7: I believe this is a VERY dangerous drug and would recommend against starting it.  If you are on it
column8: try switching to something less severe and then titrate off.  There is no way of knowing the length of time I will have to suffer with these symptoms and apparently there is no relief from them.

column2: along with the shakes and chills if I missed even 1 day of the medication. Weening myself off of it was even worse
column3: with those side effects amplified times ten. I also developed a severe anxiety disorder after coming off it 2 years ago that I have been struggling with ever since. Effexor's website says it is perfectly safe and not addictive. THIS IS A LIE. I regret ever taking Effexor
column4: and I wish I did more research before taking it.

column1: 1104$Condition: Depression$3/15/2010 7:43:02 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  (Patient) $4$1$1$i have taken effexor xr regularly for over 5 years.  the side effects of going off of it (missing from one dose to several) are so severe i get anxiety just thinking about it.  i recently went off of it suddenly and the withdrawal symptoms ranged from the most severe nausea I've ever experienced (including vomiting) to hyper-sensitivity through my fingers to a brain-clicking feeling like a cd that keeps skipping to anxiety and emotional upheaval.  the side effects lasted about 2 weeks and I've decided not to take the medication anymore because i don't EVER want to have to experience them again. ever.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking Effexor entering into six years.  My prior experiences with anti-depressants has not been positive (dramatic mood changes)

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I got on Effexor when I was severly depressed due to marriage problems and I was suicidal.   It got me through one of the roughest years of my life.   However

column4: my father is dying and I just lost my job (no I am not making this up) so I may have to get back on it to deal with the depression.    To me the good things were worth having to wean myself off of it.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $1$1$2$"Low-dose (75mg. daily) Effexor XR has not alleviated symptoms of menopause exacerbated by use of Tamoxifen following early stage breast cancer surgery and radiation. Furthermore

Controlled research needs to be undertaken with scientifically based recommendations following for those of us

column1: experiencing ""brain zaps"" that cause momentary disorientation.  Perhaps we need an investigation into this by FDA or a watchdog group to determine what the manufacturer knows

column5: which allows me to get a restful nights sleep.  It has made a tremendous difference overall
column6: I'm back to my happy
column7: positive self.  I feel like the old me before menopause began.  My husband & I can cuddle again without me having to pull away due to hot flashes!

column1: I also was experiencing increased migraines before Effexor which I suspect was largely due to lack of sleep (and hormone flux because of menopause).  These too have been less frequent.  I have not noticed any weight gain with this product and I found I have lots and lots of energy again.  After reading the other reviews regarding addiction
column2: I do intend to speak to my doctor about going back down to the 37.5mg level.  Even that level made a big difference in the night sweats.  I am not a proponent of taking pills for everything
column3: but believe me I tried all the 'natural' remedies with no success."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$1$"I was on Effexor XR for 8 years for depression/mild anxiety through the end of high school and through college. I had been on various dosages of Prozac
column3: Zoloft
column4: Paxil with either poor side effects (inability to orgasm) or poor effectiveness. Doc put me on 150mg of Effexor XR. It helped my depression
column5: anxiety and libido but the side effects and withdrawl were horrible and TOTALLY debilitating!

column1: I was getting my prescriptions through MedCo's mail order system so it was very easy to be out of meds and at least 3 days from getting any more. The worst withdrawl symptom was a nauseous dizzy feeling in my head. I could not move around without feeling as though my brain were somewhat disconnected from my head. It would worsen with each day to the point of nearly vomiting! Let me be very clear here
column2: I could not move my body without feeling like I was going to barf! And I have an iron stomach!

column1: Another serious effect that I have experienced is hand tremors. It has been 12 years since I began taking Effexor XR and 4 years since I stopped and my hands still shake
column2: sometimes so bad that people ask me if I have Parkinson's Disease!! Most of the time people say nothing but look at me like I am a junkie! I have been to the Doc and they ran tests and have no explanation- even though I KNOW that I never had this problem until I went on Effexor XR.

column1: I would recommend this pill because it helped me overcome a severe depression but I caution strongly against it if you have a hard time keeping a pill schedule.

column2: as a biologist

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on the 150mg of Effexor XR for about 6 months and it has changed my life. I was taking the pill at night and was so tired during the day and not sleepy at bedtime. About a month ago I swithed and started taking the pill in the morning. column1: 1396$Condition: Depression$10/3/2009 12:36:34 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$3$"I took Effexor 150 (mg) for three years.  Missed a dose
column2: here and there
column3: and the withdrawal was intense.  The electric shock feeling was terrifying the first time. I complained to my doctor ans was told that the ""shock"" feeling might actually be a plummet in saratonin levels.  So
column4: on my own
column5: I cut back
column6: first to 75mg per day and then half again.  I was able to go dose free for 2-3 days before the ""shock"" would come and I'd take a pill.  I continued just treating the ""shocks"" as they came until I was pill free for days
column7: then weeks at a time.  If you are ready to wean off Effexor
column8: get your doctor to lower and break up your dosage (instead of 2x75mg per day
column9: ask for 4x32.5). This will help you begin slowly skipping one dose and so on.  Effexor is a fantastic medication and it doesn't have to be a nightmare (literally) to come off it.  Pay attention to your ""shocks"" or crashes as you lower your dosage and treat only when you feel them.  It will work.  I was completely off the medication within three months and I had very little hardship. "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$This is my second time on effexor xr 75mg. The medicine worked great the first time for my extreme anxiety of everyday life.  I lived in a constant state of panic.  Yes

column4: I know this medicine works.  The first time on effexor xr for more than a year; I experienced the terrible effects if I missed a dose.  But
column5: I also know whats its like not to even want your two precious children come towards you because they made nervous. I went back on the effexor when I also lost my fourteen year old daughter to Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever.  When you almost lose a child you realize its time to quit being young and stupid and think you can handle things on your own.  I would rather deal with some unwanted side effects and unpleasant feelings than to not enjoy my childrens life. Plus
column6: I noticed the way I lived in fear affected my children.  And my daughter has shown signs of the same anxiety.  I realize getting help means helping to teach my children to enjoy and embrace everyday God gives us.  And if I am having a bad effexor day
column7: I except that its not a good day and know tomorrow is a new day. Also
column8: taking a 0.5 mg Xanax helps control the side effects when starting effexor xr.  It helps with the nervousness and rapid heart rate.  Took it three times a day the first week when starting and reduced the xanax til 2 a day and sometimes those are just half a pill.  Ask your dcotor about something to take the edge off when starting a effexor because it takes years or more for our nerves to get bad; so it takes the effexor some time to undo the damage our nerves has caused(there is no shame in it).

Please do not take the first doctor's prescription and believe that he/she has your best interest in mind.  Please seek second or third opinions. column1: 1671$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$6/1/2009 9:01:10 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I have always had the normal bouts with anxiety but around 6 months ago
column2: while I was away on a conference trip
column3: I began having anxiety attacks (excelerated heatbeat
column4: feeling of something bad was going to happen if I drive over the bridge). Then when I got home
column5: the anxiety got worse.  I felt like I was losing my mind
column6: totally unlike myself. I decided I needed to see my doctor immediately because I knew something was not right.  He gave me Effexor-I started on 37.5 dose for 10 days
column7: then increased to 75mg a day.  The first time I took it
column8: I felt this overwhelming sensation of cool happiness and I knew it was going to help me.  My anxiety didn't completely go away but it has made a huge difference in how I felt during that time.  My doctor said he can increase the dosage but I didn't want to for fear of being overly medicated and too dependent on it.  Now that I have been on it for 6 months
column9: I feel okay to increase it
column10: if need be.  I am a little apprehensive of what type of withdrawal side effects I will feel
column11: but I am confident in my doctor and will follow his instructions to decrease my dosage slowly.  I know everybody has their own experience with this medication
column12: but I wanted to share mine in hope's that it will help someone feel okay about taking it.  I had not intended to write this review but I read the guy's experience who wrote on 5/30/09 @ 3:21pm and it touched me.  So I hope this will help someone. Also
column13: turning to my faith
column14: family
column15: and friends has been a tremendous help.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I must be lucky. I'm on 37.5mg 2x per day
column3: have been for about 4 months. After 5 years of depressive symptoms & then being diagnosed with PTSD
column4: I have to say my life has completely turned around. The only side effect has been minor headaches
column5: but thankfully not daily. It did take some time to work & some days I am ""moody"" but I chalk that up to the normalacy of life. I get along better with everyone

column1: 1675$Condition: Depression$5/30/2009 3:21:48 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$3$5$"Had anx. most my life.  Then hit with some depression few months ago. Wow
column2: that's no fun.  I will never say to someone
column3: ""hey snap out of it"" Life works in funny ways sometimes.  Anyways
column4: was forced to get help with the depression. Started with lowest dose 37.5 for 10 days
column5: then 75mg for 14 days and to date at 75 + 37.5 = 112.5mg.  The hardest part was waiting for it to work
column6: It took atleast 5/6 weeks. I wanted to quit many times
column7: but stuck with it. Weird side effects along the way but help from Dr.
column8: Therapist and friends helped. The other problem was I expected when it did work to immediately make the depression just go away.  Found out ""it don't work that way"" I guess the depression came on slowly (thou I never realized) and it goes away slowly.  So I seemed to feel best in the evening and worst in the morning. Dr. said that's normal with depression. The other hurdle to get over is I'll be feeling like my old self for a day or two and ""boom"" out of the clear blue it creeps back.  Which at first really scared me and pissed me off.  How dare it
column9: after all that hard work. But
column10: with patience I slowly start feeling better again. Quite a roller coaster ride. To date
column11: I have more better days than bad days. Having to work hard at feeling just ""normal"" does suck.  But life is worth it. With so many horrible things that can happen to us
column12: I try to feel fortunate compared to those who have no real hope.  Regarding people with suicide thoughts
column13: as long as you keep them as thoughts
column14: just don't act on them.  I'm sure every adult has wondered about suicide at some point. Someone once told me that suicide is a ""Final solution to a Temporary problem"". Think about it very true.

column1: Depression/Anx are the most treatable of mental disorders.  So hang in there
column2: take baby steps
column3: and believe in the BIG Guy.  That's all I'm doing. "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$4$I have been on effexor xr 225mg for 11-12 years now. i recently had a pharmacy mix up and have reduced my dosage to 150mg.  it took a couple of weeks to feel normal again but i am surprised at all the side effects that people report.  other than night sweats
column3: weird dreams and lowered sexual desire
column4: i don't notice many other symptoms. i fear going off of this completely though which is why i have been on it so long.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$3$I have decided to stop taking Effexor. It has only been a month
column3: however I have been eating like a pig
column4: very drowsy
column5: very irritable and I cant seem to get rid of this headache. I have been weaning myself off the Effexor for a few days now. The only thing that I have experienced so far is pain behind my eyes. Weird! I will begin Wellbutrin next month. I hope this one helps me!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$2$5$Effexor XR worked great for my depression and anxiety but I need to come off it (it's too expensive) and the withdrawal is horrible. I have been off it for a week and I am constantly dizzy (even feel dizzy in my dreams) and often nauseous.  I am also really irritable and am trying to avoid my co-workers so I don't bite anyone's head off for no reason. When I'm not irritable I feel weepy and lately anxious and paranoid.  I have already started taking Wellbutrin and I think it is helping.  It is very frustrating that none of the literature talks about length of withdrawal symptoms.  I know it's different for everyone but surely someone has measured this in a test group and can publish the results from that group.  I haven't even been able to find a comment anywhere from someone saying they managed to get off it and are now finally feeling better.  Very disheartening.  Published tests of new drugs should include discontinuation symptoms and observed length of those symptoms. There is no good reason to exclude that data.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$1$Hello like many others that have taken this drug I HATE it!!!! I began effexor to treat migraines. I suffered from many of the common side effects moodiness
column3: constipation
column4: inability to become sexually aroused
column5: dehydration
column6: and weight gain. The worst part about the drug is that it is next to impossible to get off of. But I DID IT!!! You need to start by weening yourself down to the lowest dose (37.5mg). Once there take the capsule pills only. Open the capsule and each day take out 5 of the small round balls. If you feel so sick from the removal stay at that level until you feel ok. Example remove 10 for three days instead of moving on to 15 if you are feeling sick. Keep doing this until you get down to 0. It took over three months but I am finally off this dreaded medication after 3 years. It is not easy but just after a month of not being on it i feel amazing and my sex life has already changed and i am having more frequent bowel movements. This is the ONLY way to get off it. Trust me i have tried cold turkey and the skipping tablets it does NOT work. Good luck and please get off of this medication and on to something else ASAP. I hope this helps :)

column1: 1727$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$5/1/2009 6:27:48 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on and off effexor xr for 10 years
column2: works well. I have also taken the new Pristiq
column3: it helps but less for GAD.(even though they are basically the same thing-and metabolize differently. The best way to get off the effexor xr is reduce your dose to 37.5 and take 5mg or 10mg prozac. After 1 week discontinue the effexor and continue to take the prozac for 3 to 4 weeks. This should help minimize the withdrawls
column4: everyone is different so you can tweek it to your needs. I have done this many times... anyway this is food for thought for people that are having problems getting off of it!!I hope it helps!

column1: 1994$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/29/2009 6:57:47 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$3$"Before taking Effexor XR
column2: I suffered from severe panic attacks
column3: agorophobia
column4: and had generalized anxiety disorder.  First I tried Zoloft
column5: which made me feel horrible and I would literally wake up in the middle of the night having panic attacks.  After starting Effexor XR (give it a chance for your body to adjust to the medication
column6: about a month) I have not had a major panic attack in years!  NOT ONE.  Started on 37.5 mg for a few weeks
column7: then moved up to 75
column8: the to 150
column9: and took 225 mg for a few years.  You will have decreased energy
column10: increased sweating
column11: and lucid dreams.  All of these went away for me after using it for a few months.  When my dose was being increased
column12: the symptoms would return for a week or so.  Not for high BP patients.

column1: Wean slowly...slower than you think.  I've been weaning for months now and have had great success.  DO NOT CUT YOUR DOSES IN HALF when trying to get off the med.  Instead
column2: go down by 37.5 mg each month or so.  Seems conservative
column3: but the side effects aren't as severe.

column2: this med is outrageously expensive.  I was paying as much as $240 a month at one point (with excellent insurance).  No generic!  When I missed a dose
column3: I also paid the price.  Your head feels very ""swimmy"".  Light and sound was almost unbearable.  Take it in the morning with a light breakfast to curb insomnia in the evening.

column1: Effexor XR has honestly changed my life.  I can leave my house
column2: drive
column3: be a good mom
column4: and maintain healthy relationships again.  Hang in there!             "

Since going on it I have been diagnosed with Disassociative Personality Disorder; I have also become an alcoholic. When I told my doctor how much I drank
column3: he told me I really shouldn't do that any more. I am suicidal but benefit from the personality disorder since part of me remains the caretaker of human beings and animals and birds that I have been for my whole life. My brother shot his rifle at me because I had refused to let him molest me at less than 9 years of age
column4: my father both sexually assualted and abused me at an early age and also told me that I should have been killed as a defective being; my mother told me from an early age that as the second born twin I would have been killed at birth had I been born in Africa. (note: I'm not African). I thought Effexor RX would help me get through a difficult stage as a government whistle blower. Instead I am addicted to it and lorazapan and alcohol. If I didn't have the ability and opportunity to care for beings and creatures less fortunate
column5: I would have left this world.  No
column6: I don't think any medicene that requires taking it for 12 years and with no end in sight is good. Treating a symptom does not treat the person or the cause.  And anyone on these meds should realize that most medical studies only look at the complications of usage for 6 months or less. The analytical side of me tells me that there is something very wrong in an advanced society that perpetuates drug usage rather than helping individuals to overcome emotional trauma.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$1$4$"I am currently taking Effexor XR
column3: and I have been taking it for the past 3-4 years (at least). I became depressed early in High School when I underwent extensive back surgery and my parents got a divorce. These two events happened simultaneously
column4: and my father falsely blamed me for the divorce. This led to my severe depression and self-hatred. I convinced my father to let me talk to my General Practitioner about depression
column5: because he doesn't believe in ""Shrinks."" After trying many other antidepressants (Prozac
column6: Lexapro
column7: Elavil
column8: and others)
column9: my GP decided to start me on Effexor. I was 15 years old at the time. I was not made aware of the drug's short half-life
column10: nor was I told of the extreme dependence I would develop. I have been taking a very high dose (300mg daily) since I began the drug
column11: and I absolutely hate it. As far as my depression symptoms go
column12: this drug has been very effective in controlling them. However
column13: if I miss just one dose
column14: I suffer extreme ""brain shocks
column15: dizziness
column16: chills
column17: shaking
column18: and other withdrawal symptoms. I have talked with my GP about stopping this drug
column19: but she will not assist me with it
column20: because she believes I need to take it at least until I graduate from college. I am currently searching for a Psychiatrist who will understand this drug more thoroughly and who will help me break my addiction. I do not want to live my life dependent on a drug
column21: and I wish I had never begun taking Effexor. Please consider VERY carefully the side effects and the dependence-causing qualities of this drug before you agree to take it. Also
column22: be sure your doctor fully understands your condition. If you are suffering from a mental illness

column1: 2179$Condition: Depression$11/24/2008 9:05:16 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$3$"This drug worked great (much better than other antidepressants) for me for a few years
column2: then the good effects seemed to wear off.  Sexual side effects were awful also.
this is not a scientific claim at all
column3: but I and others have noticed that it seems to make you smoke a LOT more (if you smoke already)- I tried another bout w/ this drug recently and it didn't work how it did the first time - still made me smoke like a fiend though
column4: and maybe even made me crave alcohol more
column5: too.

column1: This drug is VERY hard to get off of.  I had the ""brain shivers"" for several MONTHS after reaching a 0 dose after tapering down off of it as slowly as possible.

column2: considering its withdrawal symptoms and the fact that it didn't feel the same when I ""retried"" it is that I sort of felt/feel nervous that it changed my brain or something.  I feel like I am not nearly as smart/quick as I was before I ever took it.  I can't say that this drug caused that
column3: but it seems to be the determining factor.

column2: I would say that anyone should be careful taking this drug b/c it is very powerful.  It can help a lot
column3: but it is very easy to become dependent on
column4: and might end up changing you.  It's not a good first choice for folks who just need ""a little help getting through the holidays"" or need a little help after a bad event.  It is more appropriate (in my opinion) for someone willing and able to continue w/ it (if it works well) for chronic/serious depression.

column1: 2231$Condition: Other$11/4/2008 12:53:48 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I took this medication for anxiety and depression
column2: but mostly for anxiety. During my teen years it helped me concentrate in class as well. I started taking it at age 17 and recently stopped it due to pregnancy. Tapering off of it was not hard for me and I notice only slight physical symptoms of anxiety currently. (Since I learned how to cope without the medicine) It is category C for pregnancy so I decided to stop using it because the baby would be exposed to it. I believe it is worth it for my child's brain to function normally while in the womb. I had no side effects. The extended release capsules were a 'life saver' compared to the generic venlafaxin because the generic I had to take twice a day and I could not sleep; it disrupted my daily life. I tried 3 brands before this one and after 3-4 years of switching my doctor gave me this and it along with counseling helped me to learn to cope with life in a healthy way. My mother takes the same brand and it works for both of us better than any other brand. I keep suggesting it to my sister since I think depression could be hereditary in our family. I would recommend this medicine to anyone. I did not feel like it took over my mood or personality
column3: it only allowed me to try to function normally and get my life back on track in a positive way.

column1: 2285$Condition: Depression$10/20/2008 2:12:58 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"To those saying Effexor should be removed from the market
column2: let's be fair - different meds work in different ways for different people. It is your (along with your doctor's) responsibility to research new medications before starting to put them into your body. My doctor warned me about the side effects and let me make the decision to try Effexor to determine if the benefits outweigh the detriments. I have experienced increased sweating (I knew that to be a possible side effect) as well as the withdrawal symptoms many have described (""electrical storm in the head""
column3: dizziness
column4: etc.) but luckily
column5: I knew what to expect and the effects were manageable. It is absolutely IMPERATIVE that you discuss ramping the dosage up/down when you start/stop Effexor XR. If your health care provider does not mention the possible withdrawal symptoms associated with missing a dosage or stopping Effexor ""cold turkey""
column6: they do not know enough about this medication to be prescribing it. If this medication does not work for you (give it 6-10 weeks for full effect)
column7: taper the dosage and get off - try something else. I only remain on Effexor because it works to manage my depression. As common sense would indicate
column8: do not stay on this medication if the benefits do not outweigh the side effects. The withdrawal symptoms will be worse than any of the side effects you experience on Effexor
column9: but they ARE temporary (so far as we know) and will go away after ~ one week. I have been on and off different dosages for years and can tell you that it's not a drug to put in your body unless you are aware of and understand the potential undesired effects."

That relieved my withdrawal for a few hours usually.  They don't make non XR anymore as far as I know but I would also call up the toll free Effexor line and scream at them whenever possible.  I would suggest that the company make the non-XR for this reason.

column1: 2430$Condition: Depression$9/8/2008 5:27:03 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$"I guess the fact that a drug doesn't work on some individuals doesn't make it a BAD or DANGEROUS drug then
column2: when it DOES help or work on some others. I've read up the reviews on most antidepressants & can see that almost everyone experiences side-effects & withdrawal symptoms - some none
column3: some mild
column4: & others severe. They say ""No pain no gain.""

column2: so it's best if one does some research on their own & not rely fully on their doctor for info.

column1: One has to weigh the pros. & cons. of taking a drug themselves
column2: not getting discouraged by others' unpleasant experiences. For example
column3: before taking Effexor
column4: I was sad 24/7. I would curl up in bed whole day
column5: re-playing hurtful & unpleasant memories from past
column6: & getting so worked up over them (angry/sad) all over again. I kept thinking of all sorts of sad things & just cried & cried. I wanted my husband to stay with me all the time; I was so demanding. I didn't want to go out or do anything. My world was so dark & gloomy. I even got suicidal
column7: thinking of quick & painless ways to die. Everything seemed hopeless
column8: like I was never going to get better
column9: ever. I just wanted to die. Or I believed I was seriously going insane. Now
column10: although Effexor mostly makes me so drowsy & fatigued & causes some other inconveniences
column11: I'd rather suffer from these for a while than go back to the miserable & horrifying state I was in
column12: which was a whole lot more difficult for others to deal with.

column2: if you can afford it
column3: try counseling by a psychologist. It sped up my recovery by miles."

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have worked for several years with my doctor and mental health therapist to find ways to minimize the symptoms of chronic depression with exacerbations of seasonal affective disorder.  After much experimentation we hit on the combination of taking Wellbutrin year-round for the chronic depression and adding Effexor XR in varying doses throughout 9 months of the year to treat the seasonl affective disorder.

column1: I start taking 37.5 mg of Effexor in the middle of August
column2: increasing to 75 mg at the middle of October and to 112.5 mg at the end of November.  I maintain that dose all winter
column3: until the beginning of April when I begin decreasing the dose at about 3-week intervals so that I'm off the Effexor by the middle of May.

column1: I have tried decreasing the dose more quickly than that
column2: but like many others have reported
column3: the side effects made me very uncomfortable.  (I have learned
column4: when weaning off
column5: to carry one 37.5 mg capsule with me to take if I'm feeling especially uncomfortable
column6: but find I have rarely needed to take it.)

column1: While the medicine has been indispensable in relieving my suffering
column2: I also must report the importance of behavioral interventions – showering and getting dressed every day
column3: getting outside daily (even if it’s just to sit on the porch)
column4: calling or visiting friends when I’m feeling down
column5: and seeing my mental health therapist and/or doctor when I’m feeling overwhelmed.  They help me to see how my thoughts may be contributing to the depression and how I can get back on track.

column2: don’t give up.  Try the interventions your doctor suggests
column3: and let him or her know what works and what doesn’t so that your treatment can be tailored to you.

column1: 2460$Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$8/18/2008 6:54:01 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$4$"I was on Effexor 150mg for 2yrs. When I talked to my doctor about discontinuing use he put me on a ""step down"" pack.  One week at 75mg
column2: then one week at 37.5mg then nothing.  At 75mg and 37.5mg I felt a little nausea
column3: lightheadedness
column4: and tired for a few days after starting each dose.  I too wondered what ""brain zaps"" were. I found out after the drug was out of my system. For one week I experienced what I could only describe as like ""little seizures"". Like little electrical ""zaps"" in my head & ears
column5: accompanied by ""zaps"" of tingling sensations in my lips
column6: face
column7: neck and hands. I have never experienced anything like this
column8: ever. I am now in week two..8 days off of the med.
column9: these symptoms seem to be getting gradually better.  Its been frightening. I have researched Effexor
column10: trying to find info. about the withdrawal symptoms
column11: but wouldn't you know it.. there's hardly any mention..""sensory symptoms"". Effexor is an effective medication
column12: but there should be more info. put out there to doctors
column13: and patients about what happens when this drug is discontinued. I was told ""flu like symptoms""
column14: not neurological disturbances
column15: and I'm feeling pretty angry about that. There should be more straight forward patient information put out there by this drug mfr. Doctors need to be better educated about side effects of these types of meds
column16: not just relying on the pharm. salesperson.  "

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$1$4$Effexor xr has turned my life inside - out; and not for the good. I'm glad we have the chance to warn the public about this horrible drug. I don't care which experts say this medication is not addictive - they lie!!! It helps you in the beginning after you get passed the initial side effects. You then feel almost euphoric and happy. As you progress with the 'treatment' then I (along with many others) began to notice a change. You think you're just more confident and can't understand why everyone else thinks you've become an arrogant ass. That's because you are and don't realize it. You may become angry and act like a complete fool at 'the drop of a hat'. Then the darkness begins to cloud you're mind and you realize you've become a 'legal' junkie. You need this to feel in control. Nightmares may occur whenever you are able to actually sleep
column3: dry mouth
column4: weight gain
column5: constipation
column6: mood swings
column7: dizzy spells and migraine headaches begin to occur more often; until you realize you're lost in a drug induced maze. I'm am fighting the worst battle of my life coming off of the Devil's candy. It will eventually destroy you.

column8: and become jumpy and fearful - even irrational. That makes me paranoid about running out

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$4$When I first began Effexor XR 37.5 dose I was sick and unable to sleep but I noticed that I was improving emotionally. Then I progressed to the 75 dose I began experiencing fatigue and headaches; but I was beginning to feel more at ease and had better concentration and I was ready for the 150 dose
column3: according go my doctor. When on the  150 dose I was at times experiencing extreme fatigue and weight gain
column4: along with headaches and chronic constipation. However
column5: I was extremely happy with the results in the beginning. I had self confidence that I never had before and was convinced that I would use this drug forever. I was calm and level headed and for once liked myself. Over a period of time I noticed my growing dependence on this drug. My weight gain was out of control and I bruised very easily. My self confidence turned into aggression that raged out of control. My family would not accompany me anywhere during this time because my temper was out of control and I would 'mouth off' to anyone who looked at me wrong. Then the dizzy spells started to occur and nightmares started. It has been a long road to hell and back trying to get off this drug. I will succeed in getting my life and family back. I'm now at the 75 dose again and my body is craving more Effexor - it's unreal. Next week I'll try to cut the dose to 37.5 but I am afraid because of all the hell I'm going through to get off these pills. Effexor XR will make a 'junkie' out of you - just because it's legal doesn't make it any better than the illegal street drugs. The symptoms are the same and it can eventually ruin your life.

column1: 2672$Condition: Depression$5/10/2008 1:28:04 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I have been taking Effexor XR 75mg for 4.5 years now.  It has given me my life back.

column2: as I didn't want to face what I perceived as a stigma against depressed folks as deficient in character
column3: lacking in faith
column4: or ""crazy.""  Finally things got so bad (not getting out of bed on the weekends
column5: suicidal thoughts)
column6: that I

column1: gave up"" and went to see a counselor.  That was the best decision of my life (other than marrying my wife.. although I guess you could say that THAT wouldn't have happened had I not sought help!).
So after seeking help seven years ago I was diagnosed with double depression and started off with Prozac.  That didn't work
column2: so switched to Zoloft.  Zoloft worked on my depression and I can vividly remember the joy of seeing leaves rustle in sunlight about 5 weeks after starting Zoloft and feeling happy for the first time years.  I gained 20 pounds of fat and lost my sex drive almost completely
column3: but I was so happy to be ""alive"" again that I lived with those side effects for a couple of years.  Eventually I wanted more
column4: so I dropped Zoloft cold turkey
column5: lost weight

The bummer about this schedule is that I have terrible nightmares and the worst night-sweats (soaking my sheets and pajama's) because of the withdrawl symptoms. If I miss a dose (god forbid!!) the withdrawls are crippling - headaches; shooting electricity type feelings originating from inside my skull and radiating out into my entire body; drastic mood swings; violent outbursts and uncontrolable anger; feeling unawake and groggy. This is just a partial list. I would like to taper off this medication
column5: but I'm afraid of the withdrawls. Effexor has been great at treating my depression and helping me to take control. If anyone has successfuly gone off of effexor
column6: I would appreciate any tips or advice you could share.

column2: so I started to take this medication. (I have tried several other prescriptions but this one worked wonders for me!)

column1: I now suffer less anxiety attacks
column2: I have become more outgoing and less nervous in social situations and my mild depression has diminished. The down side to this was the fact that I have gain a significant amount of weight (25lbs) while taking Effexor and decided about two months ago that I wanted to try life without it. column3: I have awful headaches and feel so dizzy it makes me extremely nauseous. I just lost my insurance and had to pay $150.00 for the prescription because I can't make it three days without taking it. This is a great medication but the symptoms and side effects are tough to deal with. "

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$1$4$"BEWARE~ I Had to stop taking Effexor XR 150mg abruptly (did not have the money to get my prescription). I have experienced EXTREMELY HORRIBLE side affects. My brain feels like I have an electrical shortage (7 days--continuously). My family is falling apart because they CANNOT help me. I hurt all over--from head to toe. These ""jolts"" in my brain make me feel awful
column3: which naturally alters my mood because there is NOTHING that can be done to take this away! Not to mention that after I started taking Effexor XR several years ago
column4: it decreased my sex drive; resulting in difficulty having an orgasm (something I did not have a problem with before taking Effexor)!  I have no desire for sex
column5: even though I find my husband so very sexy! Additionally
column6: I struggle with constipation; have abnormal dreams; weight loss was great (at the beginning) but not withstanding; my cholesterol and blood pressure have been up and down like my weight; and I forget a lot details and dates (something that is not conducive to my family or profession). There are times I feel like in my effort to try to minimize my anxiety
column7: I developed something much worse—an Effexor XR addiction!  If you plan to stop taking Effexor XR abruptly
column8: I strongly urge you to consider the side affects (withdrawal symptoms) with your doctor. I do not know how long this will last
column9: but I am fighting it--barely. I feel completely helpless against these symptoms
column10: and I do not ever want to go through this again."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$EffexorXR worked great for my temporary depression when I first started taking it.  It seemed like after a few years that it wasn't working as effectively with my monthly PMS
column3: too.  The doctors asked me if I wanted to increase the dosage(sure glad I didn't).  Now five years later
column4: I want to discontinue taking Effexor and I feel horrible.  I have been decreasing the dosage as my doctor instructed and only stopped taking it all together for five days and feel HORRIBLE.  I have all the symptoms that everyone else describes.  It is really sad to hear that one writer says he/she feels the withdrawal symptoms still have 6 months.  I wish I had known about the terrible withdrawl symptoms when I first started taking it.  I would have reconsidered.  I would definitely tell anyone out there to try other anti-depressants before taking this drug.  My doctor is putting me back on the low dose 37.5 mg because of my symptoms.  I am determined to get off this drug sooner or later.  I think I will try the antioxidants that other writers have been talking about and perhaps suggest to my doctor to take Prozac.

column1: 2824$Condition: Depression$3/16/2008 7:19:23 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$3$5$It worked extremely well at first. After a while some of the despression came back but the rage and anger I felt during PMS has not come back.  After about 1.5 yrs I went down to 32.5 mg because I noticed at 75 mg I just didn't have much ambition.  My house wasn't as clean as I wanted and I just didn't get much done except what absolutely had to get done.  I feel better on the 32.5.  After about a month adjustment..I am back to feeling pretty even most of the time...still feel PMS some but it is manageable and I have much more energy to do things and I feel more organized than I have since I first started taking it.  Right now...the 32.5 works well for me.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years$4$4$4$I took Effexor XR for 9 years.  I decided to go off of the drug
column3: cold turkey.  During the process I went from crying all the time.  I couldn't say anything without crying.  My brain felt like electroyde were going off all the time.  I felt very bad.  The worst thing that it did was take away my taste buds for over a month.  I couldn't taste ANYTHING.  I found a web site that mentioned this reaction and showed it to my doctor.  He called the drug company.  They were not aware of this happening.  I had printed out the artical on the web site and the drug company were really surprised.  I'm off on Effexor XR but couldn't handle the return of depression and anixety so am now on Lexapro.  Not sure if I like it yet.  I've been on this a year.
