column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$2$3$Treatment wasn't bad...until I decided to go off of it. I was given a heavy dose 300 mg/day. On it for ~18 months. Started to reduce the dosage and what I call 'neurochemelectrical discharges' started zapping my brain. It was tolerable and expected. Kept reducing the dosage slowly as directed. Finally made it down to 37.5mg/1x day and the 'neurochemeletrical' circus was raging...but slightly tolerable. Went totally off and felt like I was back in college having the worst psychadelic experience of my life. Called the Dr. and picked up two more titration packets with the 37.5s and eased them back in and then started staggering them every other day and longer. My brain finally settled down a little. I was ready to stop again
column3: and did so. I was still seeing (and mostly feeling...tracers) but they were tolerable. I was off for 8 days...yes 8 (eight
column5: etc.) so it was out of my system but the psychadelic party was still going. I broke down and took a 75mg capsule I had...just in case... Bottom line. THIS STUFF IS REALLY
column6: REALLY DIFFICULT TO GET OFF OF! Please consider this if your Dr. suggests it. Believe me
column7: I know how bad things may seem
column8: but please consider all options. I now have to start the original (or generic) Effexor at 25 mg for 7 days and then split them to 12.5 mg for 7 days. I am pretty tough (now anyway...) by most standards but this (withdrawl) is
column9: in my opinion
column10: worse than depression. I know how to take care of that now without meds. Just please look into it before getting on it.

My family doctor put me on this med after I told her I get anxious at times and I wish i could go back in time and stopped myself from taking a brain altering med that my family doctor prescribed.  Not only was the weight gain horrible but the loss in sex drive drove me insane.  I finally decided to go off but the withdrawal was so horrible
column3: i considered going back on this drug.  I had the usual side effects
column4: brain zaps
column5: etc.  But the emotional withdrawal symptoms is what is so devasting. I find myself crying and screaming when i'm alone and I have never ever had this problem pre-drug.  Please please

column7: finds this to be the correct route.  Family doctors aren't trained to see the signs of depression and anxiety.  My life is an absolute mess now and hopefully once all of the drug is out of me

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$2$5$"Effexor XR certainly helped my depression and lessened my desire to self-injure. However
column3: like many others
column4: I experience severe withdrawal symptoms if I miss a dose. I've tried to get off it to start another drug and have been unable to do so. I was up to 450 mgs whereas my father only took 75 mgs and did not have trouble getting off the drug when it was time. I experience nausea
column5: ""brain shivers""
column6: crying and severe depression when I miss more than one dose. Also cannot have an orgasm (or a very weak one anyway). Think seriously and discuss thoroughly with your doctor before starting this drug. I had tried nineteen different combinations of drugs before I started taking Effexor XR. Exhaust other possibilities first. I'm afraid that I'm going to be on this drug forever
column7: whether I need to be or not. I'm not certain that it's been worth it."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$3$4$"I take Effexxor XR 75mg
column3: once a day
column4: as I have for about 5 years. 75mg is the lowest dosage. It seems to be relatively effective. I have full medical insurance
column5: yet the cost to fill my Effexxor has never been less than $97.00. Personally
column6: I find that overly expensive. Most importantly
column7: I'd caution any and everyone considering taking Effexxor to research its side effects beforehand. Personally
column8: I found the side effects to be nothing short of nightmarish. I 'm very regimented about taking my Effexxor every day at roughly the same time everyday. On the rare occassion that I missed a dose
column9: let's say on a Tuesday morning; by Wednesday morning & CERTAINLY by Wednesday evening
column10: I am completely nauseous
column11: my equilibrium is totally off kilter
column12: my pupils begin to dilate
column13: then decrease down to the size of a ""pin dot""
column14: and alternate back & forth until I am able to take my next dose. I become extremely dizzy
column15: and was literally afraid to drive my car. The side effects are so fierce
column16: that I have only missed a dose perhaps 3 times in 5 years. Even then
column17: it was a result of me unexpectedly having to stay overnight out of town on business - or some other extinuating circumstance. I don't mean to be disparaging
column18: I'm simply an advocate of self education re: psychotherapeutic meds because every person reacts differently to any drug & often times
column19: physicians can't quite fathom the toll certain aspects of certain drugs have on our personal health and lifestyle."

column1: 3434$Condition: Other$10/4/2007 12:23:25 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$Menopause took my sometimes edgy personality beyond the edge
column2: and kept it hostage.  Any upset became fly off the handle blind anger.  This med stopped the derailment
column3: totally and completely.  And immediately.  I still get angry
column4: but it doesn't overtake me anymore.  I wish I could recapture the first two weeks on 39.5 mg; absolute contentment.  Doubling that did not much of anything; doubling it again (today) has been nice
column5: but I still deal with being me.  I was afraid of meds like this; felt if I couldn't do it myself
column6: I was weak and worthless.  Lemme tell ya
column7: this med has made me ME again
column8: to where I can interact with the world again instead of evading because I fear yet another inappropriate outburst.  I do like yakking with people; I am no longer sullen
column9: which prevented that.  On the job
column10: instead of finding fault with everything and anything
column11: I've recaptured the joy in my ability to do what I do.  One idiot I work with
column12: instead of being a source of bristling irritation
column13: is just an idiot
column14: period.  I still get angry and experience frustration; I'm still me.  But I don't find myself wanting to grab a baseball bat and knock some sense into people's heads anymore.  This med did not work for my biological daughter.  Can't judge meds like this that way.  But she did say it was nasty to get off of.  Weird positive side effect I've noticed:  when first taking
column15: and at each dosage increase
column16: my breathing is easier (I have asthma).  All in all
column17: the positive of this med (no longer itching to jump out of my skin and whack somebody) is well worth it.  I watch the ceiling at night with each dose increase; when I do sleep
column18: dreams are clearly remembered.  I am well pleased with this medication.  Me
column19: who resisted messing with my psyche to the max for years.  If you're sitting on the fence
column20: I'd say go ahead and jump in.  The water's fine.
